Penalty, see § 10.99
§ 150.031 APPLICATION; CONTENTS.
   (A)   The application for each building permit required pursuant to §
150.030 shall be made to the Chief Inspector and shall be accompanied by plans
and specifications in duplicate showing the work sought to be done. Each
building permit application shall be reviewed by the Zoning Administrator,
Village Manager or Building Official, or such designee, to ensure compliance
with the Schiller Park Zoning Ordinance. If the work will be undertaken
personally by the owner of the premises, the owner shall verify the said plans
and specifications by signing them; otherwise said plans and specifications
shall be verified and signed by the architect who drew them.
   (B)   It shall be unlawful to erect or assemble within the corporate limits
of the Village any prefabricated or factory-manufactured building having a
gross floor area in excess of 2,500 square feet and/or to use any prefabricated
or factory-manufactured building as a principal building.
   (C)   For purposes of this Chapter, “prefabricated building” or “factory-
manufactured building” shall mean any structural, load bearing or lateral load-
resisting assemblage of materials as a building or section thereof prior to
arrival at the building construction site. Building components and pre-
assembled materials produced in accordance with standard specifications
referenced by the Village Building Code, such as rolled structural steel
shapes, steel beams, steel reinforcing bars, masonry units, pre-cast wall and
beam systems, pre-constructed roof trusses, and plywood sheets shall not be
considered a “prefabricated building” or “factory- manufactured building”
within the meaning of this definition.
(Ord. 01-2302, passed 12-11-01; Am. Ord. 04-2452, passed 1-27-04; Am. Ord. 24-
4411, passed 6-20-24)
§ 150.032 EXAMINATION OF PLANS ACCOMPANYING APPLICATION; PERMIT FEES.
   (A)   The application for a permit required by §
150.030, with plans, shall be referred to the Building Official, or such
designee, who shall examine the same to determine whether the proposed
alterations will comply with the ordinance provisions relating thereto. Upon
approval, one set of plans shall be returned by the Building Official, or such
designee. No permit shall be issued except after approval of the plans and the
payment of any applicable fees provided in the fee schedule that has been
adopted by the Village Board, and which may change from time to time as
determined in the best interests of the Village.
   (B)   The applicable fees provided in the fee schedule in subsection (A),
with the exception of fees for third-party plan reviews, shall be waived for an
individual who has attained the age of sixty-two (62) years old provided that
the permit is for either 1) a single-family dwelling that the individual owns
and occupies as his or her principal residence, or has a lease that makes the
individual responsible for the real estate taxes and occupies as his or her
principal residence, and the construction value of the work for which the
permit is sought does not exceed $12,000.00; or 2) a single-family dwelling
that the individual owns and occupies as his or her principal residence and is
receiving a Cook County Senior Citizen Exemption, and the construction value of
the work for which the permit is sought does not exceed $12,000.00.
      To obtain a fee waiver, the individual must submit documentation to prove
ownership of the property that may include a deed to the property, or a lease
for the property that proves responsibility for the property's real estate
taxes; documentation to prove the property is the principal residence of the
individual and the age of the individual may include a real estate tax bill for
the property, a Driver's License, an Illinois Identification Card, Alien
Registration Card, Social Security Card, Naturalization Papers, or Birth
Certificate; or the most recent second- installment real estate tax bill that
shows the property is receiving a Cook County Senior Citizen Exemption. The
Building Official is authorized to establish additional eligibility criteria
and rules for said fee waiver.
      In the event the property no longer qualifies for the fee waiver during
the term of the permit or the construction value of the work exceeds
$12,000.00, the individual that obtained the fee waiver shall notify the
Building Official of said fact within thirty (30) days of such change. If the
Village determines that the fee waiver was approved under false pretenses or
the individual failed to notify the Village of a change in eligibility within
the required timeframe, the individual may be liable for any previously waived
fees as well as any applicable penalties or fines.
   (C)   The applicable fees provided in the fee schedule in subsection (A),
with the exception of fees for third-party plan reviews, shall be waived for a
governmental entity, not-for- profit educational or religious institution that
is exempt from the payment of real estate taxes and located within the Village
provided that the construction value of the work for which the permit is sought
does not exceed $250,000.00.
      To obtain a fee waiver, the unit of local government or institution must
submit documentation to demonstrate not- for-profit status and proof of real
estate tax exemption. The Building Official is authorized to establish
additional eligibility criteria and rules for said fee waiver.
      In the event the property no longer qualifies for the fee waiver during
the term of the permit or the construction value of the work exceeds
$250,000.00, the entity that obtained the fee waiver shall notify the Building
Official of said fact within thirty (30) days of such change. If the Village
determines that the fee wavier was approved under false pretenses or the entity
failed to notify the Village of a change in eligibility within the required
timeframe, the individual may be liable for any previously waived fees as well
as any applicable penalties or fines.
('73 Code, § 7-3) (Am. Ord. 18-4101, passed 11-1-18; Am. Ord. 19-4152, passed
5-2-19)
§ 150.033 VARIATIONS FROM PLANS.
   (A)   It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to construct
any structure in variance of approved plans pursuant to which a building permit
has been issued in conformity with §
150.030, unless such construction has been varied in accord with modified plans
and specifications which have been approved by the Chief Inspector. In the
event additional construction costs result, because of such variation, the
permittee shall pay the additional permit fee at the time such approval is
sought.
   (B)   It shall be unlawful to erect or assemble within the corporate limits
of the Village any prefabricated or factory-manufactured building having a
gross floor area in excess of 400 square feet and/or to use any prefabricated
or factory-manufactured building as a principal building.
(Ord. 01-2302, passed 12-11-01)
Penalty, see § 10.99
§ 150.034 TERM.
   (A)   No building permit required by §
150.030 shall be valid for a period of more than one year from the date of
issuance.
('73 Code, § 7-6)
   (B)   Notwithstanding the foregoing, a building permit may be extended for a
period of time of up to one (1) year from the date of expiration provided good
cause is shown prior to the expiration date. The Building Official shall have
the authority to approve or deny any extension and determine the appropriate
length of time of such extension.
(Ord. 23-4350, passed 4-6-23)
§ 150.035 GENERAL CONTRACTOR'S BOND.
   (A)   Required. It shall be unlawful to commence work on any excavation or
on any construction work in the Village involving driving or hauling machinery,
trucks or equipment over any parkway or sidewalk area or involving excavating
or leveling of any parkway or sidewalk area unless the person doing that work
shall first have filed with the Village a bond, with corporate surety,
conditioned to indemnify the Village for any damage done to any Village
property, including any curb, pavement, cable, pipe, shutoff box or other
equipment in the course of the work.
   (B)   Special time limit. Where the work contemplated includes the making of
any excavation for any structure or foundation, the bond shall also be so
conditioned that the building or structure contemplated shall be completed
within one year from the date of commencement of work or the excavation
refilled and the surface restored to its original condition.
   (C)   Amount. The bond shall be in the principal amount of $50,000, payable
to the Village in the event of any breach of the conditions of the bond.
('73 Code, § 7-7)
§ 150.036 ADDITIONAL CONTRACTOR'S BOND REQUIREMENTS.
   (A)   The following bonds shall be deposited with the Village before a
building permit, plumbing permit or any other permit required by this Chapter
is issued. This Chapter does not apply to any contractor who is protected by
The Private Detective, Private Alarm, Private Security, Fingerprint Vendor, and
Locksmith Act of 2004 (225 ILCS 447/5 et seq.) ("the Act"). Contractors falling
under the protection of this act will be regulated only by the State of
Illinois and required only to provide a copy of their State License number to
the Village of Schiller Park to comply with Village Permit Applications.
Otherwise, for those contractors not covered by the Act, the bond shall be in
such a form as approved by the Village and shall be issued by a company duly
authorized by law to issue such bonds in Illinois.
Building contractor        $10,000.00 performance bond
Plumbing contractor        $10,000.00 performance bond
Electrical contractor      $10,000.00 performance bond
Sewer and water contractor $10,000.00 performance bond
Blacktopping contractor    $10,000.00 performance bond
Sign contractor            $10,000.00 surety bond
House raising contractor   $10,000.00 indemnity bond
Wrecking contractor        $10,000.00 indemnity bond
Roofing contractor         $10,000.00 indemnity bond
 
Such bond shall require that the applicant faithfully perform the duties and
otherwise comply with the building code and all other applicable codes and
ordinances of the Village. The bond shall protect the Village against any and
all damages that may arise to the public ways and to the Village, and to any
person, in consequence or by reason of such contractor's occupation and
operation within the Village. Any contractor protected by the Act is held to
the State of Illinois standards and shall comply with those standards in order
to obtain a State of Illinois License. Any Contractor protected by the Act who
cannot produce a State of Illinois License shall not be permitted to do any
work within the Village and the State shall be notified as to the lack of
credentials of the individual applicant so that they may take action.
   (B)   In addition to any and all other bonds required to be posted by the
above referenced contractors under this section, contractors—with the exception
of those protected by the Act—shall also be required to post a license and
permit bond in the amount of $10,000.00 executed by a surety company that is
authorized to transact business in the State of Illinois as surety on the bond
with the contractor as principal on the bond, and the Village as the obligee,
for the Village's benefit and for the benefit of consumers dealing with the
contractor, conditioned that the contractor shall faithfully perform the duties
and in all things comply with the ordinances and regulations of the Village,
pertaining to the permit or license applied for. The bond shall be valid for
one year from the date of application and the bond shall provide that it may
only be terminated if the surety provided thirty (30) days notice, in writing,
by certified mail and return receipt requested to the Village of the
termination or expiration of the bond.
(Ord. 11-2828, passed 5-10-11; Am. Ord. 14-2959, passed 3-20-14)
§ 150.037 INSURANCE REQUIREMENTS.
   In addition to a bond, all contractors and subcontractors licensed in the
Village shall be required to maintain, at all times such license is in effect,
general liability insurance coverage and worker's compensation insurance
coverage. Evidence of such insurance must be filed with the Village and shall
be updated periodically upon request. This, however, does not apply to any
contractor who is protected by The Private Detective, Private Alarm, Private
Security, Fingerprint Vendor, and Locksmith Act of 2004 (225 ILCS 447/5 et
seq.) ("the Act"). Contractors falling under the protection of this act will be
regulated only by the State of Illinois and required only to provide a copy of
their State License number to the Village of Schiller Park to comply with
Village Permit Applications. Otherwise, for those contractors not covered by
the Act, the bond shall be in such a form as approved by the Village and shall
be issued by a company duly authorized by law to issue such bonds in Illinois.
   The insurance shall have the following limits for all contractors (except
those protected by the Act): general liability insurance coverage of one
million dollars ($1,000,000.00) per occurrence, personal injury coverage of two
hundred fifty thousand dollars ($250,000.00) per person, property damage
coverage of two hundred and fifty thousand dollars ($250,000.00) per occurrence
for general contractors and one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) per
occurrence for subcontractors and workers compensation insurance in an amount
in accordance with current state statute. Such insurance shall include a
provision that it cannot be revoked, modified or not renewed by the company
issuing the bond without at least thirty (30) days prior written notice to the
Village. In the event such insurance coverage is not maintained, the license
and/or permit shall be revoked.
(Ord. 11-2828, passed 5-10-11; Am. Ord. 14-2959, passed 3-20-14)
OCCUPANCY CERTIFICATES
§ 150.050 REQUIRED.
   (A)   No land shall be occupied or used and no building hereafter erected or
substantially altered, as determined by the Building Inspector, shall be
occupied or used in whole or in part for any purposes until a certificate of
occupancy shall have been issued by the Village Clerk, stating that the
building complies with all the building, zoning and health laws and ordinances
of the Village.
   (B)   No change of a principal use shall be made in any building or part
thereof now or hereafter created or altered without a permit hearing been
issued by the Village Clerk and no permit shall be issued to make the change
unless it is in conformity with the provisions of all building, zoning and
health ordinances of the Village.
   (C)   Nothing in this section shall permit the continuance of the present
occupancy or use of any existing building, except as may be necessary for the
safety of life and property.
('73 Code, § 7-10)
Penalty, see § 10.99
§ 150.051 APPLICATION.
   A certificate of occupancy shall be applied for coincident with the
application for a building permit and shall be issued within ten days after the
erection or alteration of the building has been completed, provided that the
Building Inspector shall inspect and approve the building before a certificate
of occupancy shall be issued.
('73 Code, § 7-11)
§ 150.052 ISSUANCE.
   No occupancy certificate shall be issued until the applicant has paid the
Village Clerk a fee in accordance with the fee schedule that has been adopted
by the Village, by resolution, and which may change from time to time as the
Village feels necessary in the best interests of the Village. In no event shall
the Village Clerk issue a certificate of occupancy unless and until a final
inspection has been made to determine that the building complies with all the
building, zoning and health ordinances of the Village and unless and until the
Village Clerk determines that all fees required under the applicable ordinances
and fee schedule of the Village have been paid.
('73 Code, § 7-12) (Ord. 85-1600, passed 12-4-85; Am. Ord. 14-2976, passed 8-
21-14)
